intro: Andersonia gracilis, commonly known as the slender Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and delicate, orchid-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom in spring and are often short-lived. Andersonia gracilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
